intro: Anogyna, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. They produce yellow flowers that develop into spherical, seed-filled structures similar to dandelion blooms. Anogyna species are often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and they are valued for their ornamental appeal and potential medicinal uses.
